00008 use strict;
00009 use vars qw($VERSION @ISA @EXPORT @EXPORT_OK);
00010 use constant PI => 3.1415926536;
00011 use constant SIGNIFICANT => 6; # number of significant digits to be returned
00012 
00013 require Exporter;
00014 
00015 #@ISA = qw(Exporter AutoLoader);
00016 @ISA = qw(Exporter);

00018 # names by default without a very good reason. Use EXPORT_OK instead.
00019 # Do not simply export all your public functions/methods/constants.
00020 @EXPORT_OK = qw(chisqrdistr tdistr fdistr udistr uprob chisqrprob tprob fprob);
00021 $VERSION = '0.07';

00023 # Preloaded methods go here.
00024    
00025 sub chisqrdistr { # Percentage points  X^2(x^2,n)
00026     my ($n, $p) = @_;
00027     if ($n <= 0 || abs($n) - abs(int($n)) != 0) {
00028         die "Invalid n: $n\n"; # degree of freedom
00029     }
00030     if ($p <= 0 || $p > 1) {
00031         die "Invalid p: $p\n"; 
00032     }
00033     return precision_string(_subchisqr($n, $p));
00034 }
00035 
00036 sub udistr { # Percentage points   N(0,1^2)
00037     my ($p) = (@_);
00038     if ($p > 1 || $p <= 0) {
00039         die "Invalid p: $p\n";
00040     }
00041     return precision_string(_subu($p));
00042 }
00043 
00044 sub tdistr { # Percentage points   t(x,n)
00045     my ($n, $p) = @_;
00046     if ($n <= 0 || abs($n) - abs(int($n)) != 0) {
00047         die "Invalid n: $n\n";
00048     }
00049     if ($p <= 0 || $p >= 1) {
00050         die "Invalid p: $p\n";
00051     }
00052     return precision_string(_subt($n, $p));
00053 }
00054 
00055 sub fdistr { # Percentage points  F(x,n1,n2)
00056     my ($n, $m, $p) = @_;
00057     if (($n<=0) || ((abs($n)-(abs(int($n))))!=0)) {
00058         die "Invalid n: $n\n"; # first degree of freedom
00059     }
00060     if (($m<=0) || ((abs($m)-(abs(int($m))))!=0)) {
00061         die "Invalid m: $m\n"; # second degree of freedom
00062     }
00063     if (($p<=0) || ($p>1)) {
00064         die "Invalid p: $p\n";
00065     }
00066     return precision_string(_subf($n, $m, $p));
00067 }
00068 
00069 sub uprob { # Upper probability   N(0,1^2)
00070     my ($x) = @_;
00071     return precision_string(_subuprob($x));
00072 }
00073 
00074 sub chisqrprob { # Upper probability   X^2(x^2,n)
00075     my ($n,$x) = @_;
00076     if (($n <= 0) || ((abs($n) - (abs(int($n)))) != 0)) {
00077         die "Invalid n: $n\n"; # degree of freedom
00078     }
00079     return precision_string(_subchisqrprob($n, $x));
00080 }
00081 
00082 sub tprob { # Upper probability   t(x,n)
00083     my ($n, $x) = @_;
00084     if (($n <= 0) || ((abs($n) - abs(int($n))) !=0)) {
00085         die "Invalid n: $n\n"; # degree of freedom
00086     }
00087     return precision_string(_subtprob($n, $x));
00088 }
00089 
00090 sub fprob { # Upper probability   F(x,n1,n2)
00091     my ($n, $m, $x) = @_;
00092     if (($n<=0) || ((abs($n)-(abs(int($n))))!=0)) {
00093         die "Invalid n: $n\n"; # first degree of freedom
00094     }
00095     if (($m<=0) || ((abs($m)-(abs(int($m))))!=0)) {
00096         die "Invalid m: $m\n"; # second degree of freedom
00097     } 
00098     return precision_string(_subfprob($n, $m, $x));
00099 }
00100 
00101 
00102 sub _subfprob {
00103     my ($n, $m, $x) = @_;
00104     my $p;
00105 
00106     if ($x<=0) {
00107         $p=1;
00108     } elsif ($m % 2 == 0) {
00109         my $z = $m / ($m + $n * $x);
00110         my $a = 1;
00111         for (my $i = $m - 2; $i >= 2; $i -= 2) {
00112             $a = 1 + ($n + $i - 2) / $i * $z * $a;
00113         }
00114         $p = 1 - ((1 - $z) ** ($n / 2) * $a);
00115     } elsif ($n % 2 == 0) {
00116         my $z = $n * $x / ($m + $n * $x);
00117         my $a = 1;
00118         for (my $i = $n - 2; $i >= 2; $i -= 2) {
00119             $a = 1 + ($m + $i - 2) / $i * $z * $a;
00120         }
00121         $p = (1 - $z) ** ($m / 2) * $a;
00122     } else {
00123         my $y = atan2(sqrt($n * $x / $m), 1);
00124         my $z = sin($y) ** 2;
00125         my $a = ($n == 1) ? 0 : 1;
00126         for (my $i = $n - 2; $i >= 3; $i -= 2) {
00127             $a = 1 + ($m + $i - 2) / $i * $z * $a;
00128         } 
00129         my $b = PI;
00130         for (my $i = 2; $i <= $m - 1; $i += 2) {
00131             $b *= ($i - 1) / $i;
00132         }
00133         my $p1 = 2 / $b * sin($y) * cos($y) ** $m * $a;
00134 
00135         $z = cos($y) ** 2;
00136         $a = ($m == 1) ? 0 : 1;
00137         for (my $i = $m-2; $i >= 3; $i -= 2) {
00138             $a = 1 + ($i - 1) / $i * $z * $a;
00139         }
00140         $p = max(0, $p1 + 1 - 2 * $y / PI
00141             - 2 / PI * sin($y) * cos($y) * $a);
00142     }
00143     return $p;
00144 }
00145 
00146 
00147 sub _subchisqrprob {
00148     my ($n,$x) = @_;
00149     my $p;
00150 
00151     if ($x <= 0) {
00152         $p = 1;
00153     } elsif ($n > 100) {
00154         $p = _subuprob((($x / $n) ** (1/3)
00155                 - (1 - 2/9/$n)) / sqrt(2/9/$n));
00156     } elsif ($x > 400) {
00157         $p = 0;
00158     } else {   
00159         my ($a, $i, $i1);
00160         if (($n % 2) != 0) {
00161             $p = 2 * _subuprob(sqrt($x));
00162             $a = sqrt(2/PI) * exp(-$x/2) / sqrt($x);
00163             $i1 = 1;
00164         } else {
00165             $p = $a = exp(-$x/2);
00166             $i1 = 2;
00167         }
00168 
00169         for ($i = $i1; $i <= ($n-2); $i += 2) {
00170             $a *= $x / $i;
00171             $p += $a;
00172         }
00173     }
00174     return $p;
00175 }
00176 
00177 sub _subu {
00178     my ($p) = @_;
00179     my $y = -log(4 * $p * (1 - $p));
00180     my $x = sqrt(
00181         $y * (1.570796288
00182           + $y * (.03706987906
00183             + $y * (-.8364353589E-3
00184               + $y *(-.2250947176E-3
00185                 + $y * (.6841218299E-5
00186                   + $y * (0.5824238515E-5
00187                     + $y * (-.104527497E-5
00188                       + $y * (.8360937017E-7
00189                         + $y * (-.3231081277E-8
00190                           + $y * (.3657763036E-10
00191                             + $y *.6936233982E-12)))))))))));
00192     $x = -$x if ($p>.5);
00193     return $x;
00194 }
00195 
00196 sub _subuprob {
00197     my ($x) = @_;
00198     my $p = 0; # if ($absx > 100)
00199     my $absx = abs($x);
00200 
00201     if ($absx < 1.9) {
00202         $p = (1 +
00203             $absx * (.049867347
00204               + $absx * (.0211410061
00205                 + $absx * (.0032776263
00206                   + $absx * (.0000380036
00207                     + $absx * (.0000488906
00208                       + $absx * .000005383)))))) ** -16/2;
00209     } elsif ($absx <= 100) {
00210         for (my $i = 18; $i >= 1; $i--) {
00211             $p = $i / ($absx + $p);
00212         }
00213         $p = exp(-.5 * $absx * $absx) 
00214             / sqrt(2 * PI) / ($absx + $p);
00215     }
00216 
00217     $p = 1 - $p if ($x<0);
00218     return $p;
00219 }
00220 
00221    
00222 sub _subt {
00223     my ($n, $p) = @_;
00224 
00225     if ($p >= 1 || $p <= 0) {
00226         die "Invalid p: $p\n";
00227     }
00228 
00229     if ($p == 0.5) {
00230         return 0;
00231     } elsif ($p < 0.5) {
00232         return - _subt($n, 1 - $p);
00233     }
00234 
00235     my $u = _subu($p);
00236     my $u2 = $u ** 2;
00237 
00238     my $a = ($u2 + 1) / 4;
00239     my $b = ((5 * $u2 + 16) * $u2 + 3) / 96;
00240     my $c = (((3 * $u2 + 19) * $u2 + 17) * $u2 - 15) / 384;
00241     my $d = ((((79 * $u2 + 776) * $u2 + 1482) * $u2 - 1920) * $u2 - 945) 
00242                 / 92160;
00243     my $e = (((((27 * $u2 + 339) * $u2 + 930) * $u2 - 1782) * $u2 - 765) * $u2
00244             + 17955) / 368640;
00245 
00246     my $x = $u * (1 + ($a + ($b + ($c + ($d + $e / $n) / $n) / $n) / $n) / $n);
00247 
00248     if ($n <= log10($p) ** 2 + 3) {
00249         my $round;
00250         do { 
00251             my $p1 = _subtprob($n, $x);
00252             my $n1 = $n + 1;
00253             my $delta = ($p1 - $p) 
00254                 / exp(($n1 * log($n1 / ($n + $x * $x)) 
00255                     + log($n/$n1/2/PI) - 1 
00256                     + (1/$n1 - 1/$n) / 6) / 2);
00257             $x += $delta;
00258             $round = sprintf("%.".abs(int(log10(abs $x)-4))."f",$delta);
00259         } while (($x) && ($round != 0));
00260     }
00261     return $x;
00262 }
00263 
00264 sub _subtprob {
00265     my ($n, $x) = @_;
00266 
00267     my ($a,$b);
00268     my $w = atan2($x / sqrt($n), 1);
00269     my $z = cos($w) ** 2;
00270     my $y = 1;
00271 
00272     for (my $i = $n-2; $i >= 2; $i -= 2) {
00273         $y = 1 + ($i-1) / $i * $z * $y;
00274     } 
00275 
00276     if ($n % 2 == 0) {
00277         $a = sin($w)/2;
00278         $b = .5;
00279     } else {
00280         $a = ($n == 1) ? 0 : sin($w)*cos($w)/PI;
00281         $b= .5 + $w/PI;
00282     }
00283     return max(0, 1 - $b - $a * $y);
00284 }
00285 
00286 sub _subf {
00287     my ($n, $m, $p) = @_;
00288     my $x;
00289 
00290     if ($p >= 1 || $p <= 0) {
00291         die "Invalid p: $p\n";
00292     }
00293 
00294     if ($p == 1) {
00295         $x = 0;
00296     } elsif ($m == 1) {
00297         $x = 1 / (_subt($n, 0.5 - $p / 2) ** 2);
00298     } elsif ($n == 1) {
00299         $x = _subt($m, $p/2) ** 2;
00300     } elsif ($m == 2) {
00301         my $u = _subchisqr($m, 1 - $p);
00302         my $a = $m - 2;
00303         $x = 1 / ($u / $m * (1 +
00304             (($u - $a) / 2 +
00305                 (((4 * $u - 11 * $a) * $u + $a * (7 * $m - 10)) / 24 +
00306                     (((2 * $u - 10 * $a) * $u + $a * (17 * $m - 26)) * $u
00307                         - $a * $a * (9 * $m - 6)
00308                     )/48/$n
00309                 )/$n
00310             )/$n));
00311     } elsif ($n > $m) {
00312         $x = 1 / _subf2($m, $n, 1 - $p)
00313     } else {
00314         $x = _subf2($n, $m, $p)
00315     }
00316     return $x;
00317 }
00318 
00319 sub _subf2 {
00320     my ($n, $m, $p) = @_;
00321     my $u = _subchisqr($n, $p);
00322     my $n2 = $n - 2;
00323     my $x = $u / $n * 
00324         (1 + 
00325             (($u - $n2) / 2 + 
00326                 (((4 * $u - 11 * $n2) * $u + $n2 * (7 * $n - 10)) / 24 + 
00327                     (((2 * $u - 10 * $n2) * $u + $n2 * (17 * $n - 26)) * $u 
00328                         - $n2 * $n2 * (9 * $n - 6)) / 48 / $m) / $m) / $m);
00329     my $delta;
00330     do {
00331         my $z = exp(
00332             (($n+$m) * log(($n+$m) / ($n * $x + $m)) 
00333                 + ($n - 2) * log($x)
00334                 + log($n * $m / ($n+$m))
00335                 - log(4 * PI)
00336                 - (1/$n  + 1/$m - 1/($n+$m))/6
00337             )/2);
00338         $delta = (_subfprob($n, $m, $x) - $p) / $z;
00339         $x += $delta;
00340     } while (abs($delta)>3e-4);
00341     return $x;
00342 }
00343 
00344 sub _subchisqr {
00345     my ($n, $p) = @_;
00346     my $x;
00347 
00348     if (($p > 1) || ($p <= 0)) {
00349         die "Invalid p: $p\n";
00350     } elsif ($p == 1){
00351         $x = 0;
00352     } elsif ($n == 1) {
00353         $x = _subu($p / 2) ** 2;
00354     } elsif ($n == 2) {
00355         $x = -2 * log($p);
00356     } else {
00357         my $u = _subu($p);
00358         my $u2 = $u * $u;
00359 
00360         $x = max(0, $n + sqrt(2 * $n) * $u 
00361             + 2/3 * ($u2 - 1)
00362             + $u * ($u2 - 7) / 9 / sqrt(2 * $n)
00363             - 2/405 / $n * ($u2 * (3 *$u2 + 7) - 16));
00364 
00365         if ($n <= 100) {
00366             my ($x0, $p1, $z);
00367             do {
00368                 $x0 = $x;
00369                 if ($x < 0) {
00370                     $p1 = 1;
00371                 } elsif ($n>100) {
00372                     $p1 = _subuprob((($x / $n)**(1/3) - (1 - 2/9/$n))
00373                         / sqrt(2/9/$n));
00374                 } elsif ($x>400) {
00375                     $p1 = 0;
00376                 } else {
00377                     my ($i0, $a);
00378                     if (($n % 2) != 0) {
00379                         $p1 = 2 * _subuprob(sqrt($x));
00380                         $a = sqrt(2/PI) * exp(-$x/2) / sqrt($x);
00381                         $i0 = 1;
00382                     } else {
00383                         $p1 = $a = exp(-$x/2);
00384                         $i0 = 2;
00385                     }
00386 
00387                     for (my $i = $i0; $i <= $n-2; $i += 2) {
00388                         $a *= $x / $i;
00389                         $p1 += $a;
00390                     }
00391                 }
00392                 $z = exp((($n-1) * log($x/$n) - log(4*PI*$x) 
00393                     + $n - $x - 1/$n/6) / 2);
00394                 $x += ($p1 - $p) / $z;
00395                 $x = sprintf("%.5f", $x);
00396             } while (($n < 31) && (abs($x0 - $x) > 1e-4));
00397         }
00398     }
00399     return $x;
00400 }

00402 sub log10 {
00403     my $n = shift;
00404     return log($n) / log(10);
00405 }
00406  
00407 sub max {
00408     my $max = shift;
00409     my $next;
00410     while (@_) {
00411         $next = shift;
00412         $max = $next if ($next > $max);
00413     }   
00414     return $max;
00415 }
00416 
00417 sub min {
00418     my $min = shift;
00419     my $next;
00420     while (@_) {
00421         $next = shift;
00422         $min = $next if ($next < $min);
00423     }   
00424     return $min;
00425 }
00426 
00427 sub precision {
00428     my ($x) = @_;
00429     return abs int(log10(abs $x) - SIGNIFICANT);
00430 }
00431 
00432 sub precision_string {
00433     my ($x) = @_;
00434     if ($x) {
00435         return sprintf "%." . precision($x) . "f", $x;
00436     } else {
00437         return "0";
00438     }
00439 }

00447 # Below is the stub of documentation for your module. 
00448 
00449 =head1 NAME
00450 
00451 Statistics::Distributions - Perl module for calculating probabilities and critical values of common statistical distributions
00452 
00453 =head1 SYNOPSIS
00454 
00455   use Statistics::Distributions;
00456 
00457   $uprob=uprob(-0.85);
00458   print "upper probability of the u distribution: Q(u) = 1-G(u) (u=1.43) = $uprob";
00459 
00460   $tprob=tprob(3, 6.251);
00461   print "upper probability of the t distribution: Q = 1-G (3 degrees of freedom  , t = 6.251) = $tprob";
00462 
00463   $chisprob=chisqrprob(3, 6.25);
00464   print "upper probability of the chi-square distribution: Q = 1-G (3 degrees of freedom, chi-squared = 6.25) = $chisprob";
00465 
00466   $fprob=fprob(3,5, .625);
00467   print "upper probability of the F distribution: Q = 1-G (3 degrees of freedom  in numerator, 5 degrees of freedom in denominator, F $
00468 
00469   $u=udistr(.05);
00470   print "u-crit (95th percentile = 0.05 level) = $u";
00471 
00472   $t=tdistr(1, .005);
00473   print "t-crit (1 degree of freedom, 99.5th percentile = 0.005 level) =$t";
00474 
00475   $chis=chisqrdistr(2, .05);
00476   print "Chi-squared-crit (2 degrees of freedom, 95th percentile = 0.05 level) = $chis";
00477 
00478   $f=fdistr(1,3, .01);
00479   print "F-crit (1 degree of freedom in numerator, 3 degrees of freedom in denominator, 99th percentile = 0.01 level) = $f";
00480 
00481 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00482 
00483 This Perl module calulates percentage points (6 significant digits) of the u (standard normal) distribution, 
00484 the student's t distribution, the chi-square distribution and the F distribution. 
00485 
00486 It can also calculate the upper probability (6 significant digits) of the u (standard normal), 
00487 the chi-square, the t and the F distribution.
00488 
00489 These critical values are needed to perform statistical tests, like the u test, the t test, the chi-squared test, 
00490 and the F test, and to calculate confidence intervals.
00491 
00492 If you are interested in more precise algorithms you could look at:
00493  StatLib: http://lib.stat.cmu.edu/apstat/
00494  Applied Statistics Algorithms by Griffiths, P. and Hill, I.D., Ellis Horwood: Chichester (1985)
00495 
00496 =head1 AUTHOR
00497 
00498 Michael Kospach, mike.perl@gmx.at
00499 Nice formating, simplification and bug repair by Matthias Trautner Kromann, mtk@id.cbs.dk 
00500 
00501 =cut
